title: Fast Fish Skillet
summary: The recipe Fast Fish Skillet can be made in approximately 25 minutes. This recipe serves 4 and costs $2.93 per serving. This main course has 209 calories, 24g of protein, and 11g of fat per serving. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. This recipe from KraftRecipes.com requires basil pesto, fresh basil, grape tomatoes, and zucchini. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. With a spoonacular score of 44%, this dish is good. Similar recipes are Fast Fish Tacos, Fast Fish Tacos, and Fast Asian Fish.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 99 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris

instructions: Brush fish with 2 Tbsp. dressing; cook in skillet on medium heat 3 to 4 min. on each side or until fish flakes easily with fork. Transfer to plate; cover to keep warm. Add remaining dressing, pesto, vegetables and tomatoes to skillet; cook 5 min. or until heated through, stirring frequently. Spoon over fish. Top with basil.

steps.step: Brush fish with 2 Tbsp. dressing; cook in skillet on medium heat 3 to 4 min. on each side or until fish flakes easily with fork.
Transfer to plate; cover to keep warm.
Add remaining dressing, pesto, vegetables and tomatoes to skillet; cook 5 min. or until heated through, stirring frequently.  Spoon over fish.
